title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 § 1.1 - Executive Order No. 1: Establishing an Interdepartmental Health and Hospital Council. [1]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 § 1.1 - Executive Order No. 1: Establishing an Interdepartmental Health and Hospital Council. [1]
State Regulations

As a result of legislation adopted in the 1960 Session, the
administrative functions of two temporary State health agencies, the

Interdepartmental Health Resources Board and the Joint Hospital Survey and

Planning Commission, will be transferred to the State Departments of Health and

Mental Hygiene. To provide a vehicle for the continued exchange of information
and for cooperative study and action by the State agencies with
responsibilities in the fields of health and hospital care, I hereby establish
an Interdepartmental Health and Hospital Council which shall consist of the

Commissioners of Health, Social Welfare, Mental Hygiene, Education, and

Insurance. The chairman of the Council shall be elected by the members and the
chairmanship rotated annually. This Council is hereby assigned the following functions and
activities: (1)

To conduct joint
study, planning and program development in health areas concerning two or more
departments. (2)

To serve as
organized medium of exchange of information among member agencies regarding: (2)
(a) specific health problems concerning each; (2)
(b) the
philosophies and policies which underline their problem operations; (2)
(c) the development of new programs in
individual agencies which may relate to or possibly serve or be served by
operations in other agencies. (3)

To consider new aspects of health
problems facing the State and to develop appropriate approaches or
recommendations to the Governor as indicated. (4)

To establish framework for
interdepartmental consultation. (5)

To study problems of personnel recruitment and training in health disciplines
utilized by two or more departments. Health areas to be studied shall include, but not be
limited to rehabilitation, health services for the aging, alcoholism, narcotic
addiction, mental retardation, emotional disturbances of children, standards of
hospital facilities and services, methods of financing hospital care, and
others as may be assigned by the Governor. The Council may appoint such committees, as may be
indicated, consisting of specialists from the individual departments or
agencies concerned. Each committee shall choose its own chairman who will be
responsible for guiding the work of the committee, maintaining its records and
preparing reports for the Council. The Department of Health shall provide from among its
employees the staff services for the Council and the committees. The staff functions shall include the following: (1)

Performance of necessary staff work for

Interdepartmental Health and Hospital Council, including preparation for
meetings, recording of proceedings, and follow-up of directives. (2)

Service in similar staff functions to

Governor's Council on Rehabilitation, in accord with Governor's Special Message
on Rehabilitation of March 16, 1959. (3)

Assistance to chairmen of special
committees in meeting committee objectives. (4)

Collection of pertinent data and perform
such studies as indicated to assist the Council in joint program planning. The Council may request any department or agency
represented on the Council to provide such resources, including personnel, assistance and data, as will enable the Council properly to carry out its
activities. The experimental work of the Interdepartmental Health

Resources Board and the Joint Hospital Survey and Planning Commission have
helped New York State maintain its leadership in the fields of health and
hospital care. The programs, which proved their worth, will not be continued by
the regular State departments. I look to the Interdepartmental Health and

Hospital Council to continue this progress through the joint efforts of its
member departments which are directly concerned with the health of our
people. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: March 31, 1960
